name: Regional Messaging Toolkit
description: Develop a shared set of key messages, visuals, and data points to align how partners communicate the region's identity and priorities.
leads: Tammy and Jennie (GSDC), comms staff, Marketing Committee
timeline: Pilot Q3 2026 → Review and update every 6 months
metrics: Distribution reach: 100% of partners by Q3 2026
Usage rate: 75% partners actively using within 12 months
Social engagement: 20% increase across partner channels
Downloads: 250+ in Year 1
notes:

name: Regional Infrastructure & Policy Roundtables
description: Host annual roundtables with city, county, school, and economic development leaders to coordinate capital planning, permitting, and legislative strategy.
leads: NeTia and Leslie (GSDC), Dan Weber (Initiative Foundation)
metrics: ≥ 90% of invited stakeholders attend annually
3 collaborative funding applications influenced each year
1–2 regionally aligned bonding/policy requests submitted per legislative session
notes:
Launch Q3 2026; continue annually

testing for the github

name: Civic Onboarding Protocol
description: Develop and deliver a regional onboarding experience for new elected officials, public-sector staff, and institutional leaders.
leads: Tammy (design), NeTia (outreach), Board Chair and volunteers
metrics: 100% packet delivery
≥ 80% 1:1 completion rate
≥ 50% of new leaders participate in at least one GSDC event/initiative within 6 months
notes: Begin Q1 2026; repeat post-election and key leadership transitions

name: Public Investment Playbook
description: A shared reference guide listing top regional infrastructure priorities with project status, costs, and lead agencies—used for strategic fundraising and alignment.
leads: Leslie and Tammy (GSDC), joint partner task force, city/county staff
timeline: Draft Q3 2026; updated annually
metrics: 5–8 priority projects included and tracked
$5M secured by 2029
≥ 50% of projects with cross-jurisdictional support

name: Startup Journey Map & Mentorship Exchange
description: Clarify the "idea-to-exit" business growth path and launch a structured mentorship network to guide founders and early-stage employers.
leads: Leslie and Jennie (GSDC), Initiative Foundation, SBDC, Great North Labs
timeline: Map and mentor list by Q1 2026; first pitch night by Q2 2026
metrics: 1 ecosystem map created and published
1 investor access guide produced
1 annual pitch competition held (2026–2029)
Startups supported → +10–15% increase over 2026 baseline

name: Sector-Based Business Retention & Expansion (BRE) Cycles
description: Modernize BRE strategy by organizing outreach by industry cluster and firm size—targeting specific expansion barriers.
leads: GSDC economic development team, city economic partners, SCSU for data analysis
timeline: Manufacturing pilot in Q2 2026
metrics: # of BRE visits: Goal of 100 annually, with 60% in primary sectors
% of firms receiving structured follow-up: +10–15% over 2026 baseline
# of businesses supported in expansion: +10–15% over 2026 baseline

name: Capital Access Mapping & Coaching
description: Create a centralized capital navigation system for businesses—covering grants, loans, equity, and SSBCI pathways.
leads: GSDC, SBDC, local banks, capital mapping partners
timeline: Launch Q2 2026
metrics: Workshops: ≥ 5 annually; metric = # of attendees supported
Businesses receiving support: +10% increase over 2025 Thrive baseline
Capital raised via GSDC pathways: Directional tracking based on ILT scholarship baseline

name: Business Succession & Continuity Strategy
description: Help owners in transition with tools, financial matchmaking, and successor support—especially in rural and legacy sectors.
leads: GSDC, CPAs, estate attorneys, local lenders
timeline: Toolkit by Q2 2026; pilot connector launch Q4 2026
metrics: Succession Toolkit Downloads: 60 by 2029 (≈20 annually)
Transitions Supported: ≥ 5 demonstration cases
Businesses Supported in Continuity: +10% average annually over 2026 baseline

name: Relaunched Investor Tier Model
description: Modernize GSDC's investor tiers to clearly link financial commitments with visibility, involvement, and regional impact.
leads: NeTia (GSDC), SAC team, investor relations volunteers
timeline: Relaunch for 2026 campaign cycle → Tier packets finalized by Q4 2025
metrics: Investor renewals at same or higher tier → +10% over 2026 baseline
Average annual investor contribution → +5–10% increase over 2026 baseline
Overall investor retention rate → maintain at ≥ 85%

name: Quarterly ROI Dashboard & Video Briefings
description: Deliver investor updates through a lightweight, consistent format that's visual, digestible, and usable in meetings or pitches.
leads: Jennie and Tammy (GSDC), comms team, investor services group
timeline: Launch pilot Q1 2026 → Quarterly rhythm established by Q3 2026
metrics: Open & engagement rates → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Documented usage → +10% annually over 2026 baseline for # of times ROI materials are cited
Quarterly satisfaction rating → Maintain ≥ 4.5/5 average score

name: Investor Experience Forums & Recognition Strategy
description: Host strategic, high-energy convenings that connect investors to outcomes, celebrate impact, and offer networking value.
leads: Strategic pillar leads, comms + events team, investor ops group
timeline: Start Q2 2026 → Annual calendar coordinated by end of 2025
metrics: Forum attendance & cross-sector participation → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
New pledges or upgraded tiers post-forum → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Media/social reach from recognitions → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Civic Transition Playbook
description: A region-branded onboarding guide for new public leaders—delivered within 60 days of election or appointment.
leads: GSDC staff and board with input from city/county leadership
timeline: Prototype Q1 2026 → Rolling implementation thereafter
metrics: % of new leaders onboarded within 60 days → +10% annually over 2026 baseline (target ≥ 80% by 2029)
Awareness & satisfaction scores → Maintain or improve by +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Continuity of initiatives across transitions → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Leadership Alignment Dashboard
description: An internal tool to map public and institutional leaders, monitor transitions, and track alignment opportunities.
leads: Strategic operations staff with civic partnerships oversight
timeline: Build Q3 2026 → Annual updates
metrics: Contact & role data accuracy → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Participation in cross-sector efforts → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
New collaborations or initiatives launched → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Policy Pulse Briefings
description: Annual nonpartisan briefings for civic leaders—focused on high-priority regional topics, timelines, and coordination points.
leads: GSDC with planning/policy partners (e.g., DEED, Initiative Foundation)
timeline: Pilot Q2 2026 → Annual rhythm in 2026
metrics: Attendance & repeat participation → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Knowledge retention & feedback → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Follow-up actions initiated → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Regional Cluster Identity Framework
description: Define 3-4 high-impact industry clusters based on current employer base, growth potential, and strategic assets.
leads: Leslie and economic development team with SCSU, chambers, and industry reps
timeline: Complete by Q2 2027
metrics: Cluster briefs published and used → At least 1 brief per priority cluster annually
Partners adopting shared cluster language → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Integration of clusters in workforce & BRE initiatives → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Sector-Specific BRE Roundtables & Working Groups
description: Launch ongoing roundtables for top clusters (e.g., manufacturing, logistics, health care) to identify shared needs and policy issues.
leads: GSDC economic development team + local chambers, city staff, and SCSU research partners
timeline: Begin with 2–3 priority clusters by Q1 2027
metrics: Roundtable attendance & retention → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Shared needs documented → Written summary from each roundtable
Cluster-driven initiatives launched → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Targeted Talent Pipeline Partnerships
description: Coordinate with workforce boards, K-12 systems, and postsecondary partners to align training, recruitment, and exposure efforts with top clusters.
leads: GSDC with workforce development boards, school districts, and postsecondary partners
timeline: Kick off planning in Q1 2026; pilots launched Q4 2026
metrics: Students reached through exposure efforts → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Programs aligned to cluster hiring needs → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Employer satisfaction & engagement → Maintain ≥ 4.5/5 satisfaction rating

name: Shared Federal Grant Calendar & Watchlist
description: Maintain a central, live-updated calendar and database of upcoming federal/state grant opportunities with deadlines, partners, and alignment notes.
leads: GSDC staff TBD + partner staff (Initiative Foundation EDD staff)
timeline: Launch Q1 2026; within 6 months of federal designation
metrics: Watchlist usage stats → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Joint applications informed by tool → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Partner satisfaction with information access → ≥ 4.5/5 average score on annual survey

name: Pre-Development Technical Assistance Pool
description: Create a pooled resource of technical assistance hours or funding to help regional partners prepare shovel-worthy projects before grants are announced.
leads: GSDC, city/county public works and economic development teams, Initiative Foundation
timeline: By Q3 2026: Draft framework for Pre-Development TA Pool
metrics: Projects supported pre-grant → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Funding unlocked via assistance → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Use of pool by multiple jurisdictions → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Grant Alignment Council
description: Establish a standing coordination group of regional grant writers, project leads, and agency partners to align applications, avoid duplication, and share knowledge.
leads: GSDC, Initiative Foundation, city/county grant staff, regional agencies
timeline: Convene first meeting by Q4 2026
metrics: Grants submitted jointly or with partner input → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Cross-agency participation rates → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Win rate for coordinated applications → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Regional Housing & Land Readiness Map
description: Create a shared inventory of developable land, housing pipeline projects, and zoning designations tied to regional economic needs.
leads: GSDC strategic ops team, city/county planners, housing agencies
timeline: Prototype by Q1 2028; full implementation by Q4 2029
metrics: % of jurisdictions contributing data → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Number of sites prepared for development → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Housing units & commercial projects tracked across status levels → +10% annually over baseline

name: Housing & Infrastructure Alignment Cohort
description: Convene quarterly working group of planners, EDAs, developers, Chambers of Commerce and utilities to proactively align infrastructure planning with land/housing priorities.
leads: GSDC policy and strategy leads, utility partners, Initiative Foundation
timeline: Draft by Q1 2027
metrics: Infrastructure plans coordinated with housing strategy → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Reduction in development delays linked to utility misalignment → -10% annually
Policy changes advanced through cohort recommendations → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Housing Opportunity Impact Stories
description: Package and share data-driven stories showing how housing access supports business growth, community resilience, and inclusive regional development.
leads: GSDC comms team, partner housing orgs, data partners
timeline: Begin in Q3 2026
metrics: Media and stakeholder reach of stories
Use of stories in grant apps and legislative advocacy
Qualitative feedback on message clarity

name: Boomerang Talent Campaign
description: Launch a regional campaign to attract back former residents—including alumni, young professionals, and remote workers—with job, housing, and lifestyle messaging.
leads: Gail, Tammy, GSDC Comms and Talent teams, college alumni offices
timeline: Campaign live by Q2 2026
metrics: Website traffic & social engagement → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Alumni & ex-resident database growth → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Inquiries & relocations tracked via partner orgs → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Regional Internship & First Career Connector
description: Curate opportunities for students and recent grads to access internships, apprenticeships, and early-career opportunities in high-need sectors.
leads: GSDC, HR councils, SCSU and SCTCC career centers, United Way
timeline: Pilot system by Q3 2026; annual hiring cycle support
metrics: Internships posted & filled → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Employers using the Career Connector system → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Retention of participants in region after program → +10% annually over 2026 baseline

name: Civic Engagement Pathways for Young Professionals
description: Partner with civic orgs, boards, and community initiatives to create clearer ways for young professionals to engage in public life.
leads: GSDC Talent and Leadership teams, Rotary/YP groups, public sector partners
timeline: Launch Map Q1 2027; Board Match kickoff by Q1 2028
metrics: Participants matched to civic boards/programs → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Repeat civic engagement rates → +10% annually over 2026 baseline
Satisfaction with leadership experiences → Maintain ≥ 4.5/5 survey rating
